CHRISTINE NGUYEN:
Cosmic Rabbit Light, 2023
Mixed media on Mylar — 61 × 50.8 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$ 3,000
About the artwork:

Cosmic Rabbit Light situates a delicate animal form within a suspended, luminous field, where terrestrial life appears to drift through a cosmological atmosphere. The rabbit—rendered with quiet attentiveness—functions as both subject and symbol, evoking vulnerability, intuition, and cyclical renewal. Nguyen surrounds the figure with translucent arcs, floating botanical motifs, and particulate marks that suggest motion without urgency, as if time itself has softened. Working on Mylar allows light to pass through the composition, activating layers of drawing, pigment, and photographic reference into a single, breathing surface. The image oscillates between the microscopic and the infinite, inviting the viewer to read the rabbit simultaneously as a creature of the earth and a celestial traveler—an emissary between fragile ecosystems and expansive, unseen realms.

About the artist:

Born in 1977, Christine Nguyen, based in Colorado and California, draws upon nature, sciences, and the cosmos in her luminous, photo-based drawings and mixed media works. Her philosophy emphasizes holistic symbiotic relationships, imagining realms beyond conventional readings—leaning into mysterious underwater and cosmic themes. Exhibitions like Radical Futures (2024) and Lightness Within the Cosmic Universe (2021) highlight her ability to transform the natural world into ethereal, reflective universes that encourage pause and deeper connection.

View Full Artist Profile
